question: If 10 October 2003 was a Friday, then what was the day of the week on 8 October 2015?
solution: (b) 10 October 2003 was Friday. On moving to 2015 the number of odd days = +2 + 1 + 1 + 1 + 2 + 1 +1 + 1 + 2 + 1 + 1 + 1 = 15. On dividing 15 by 7, the remainder = 1. Friday + 1 = Saturday .We have reached till 10 October 2015. But we have to go 8 October 2015, the number of days in between = 2 .Saturday - 2 = Thursday.

question: Three of the following four options are alike in a certain way and thus form a group. Which is the one that does NOT belong to that group? (NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13 ‚Äì Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)
solution:
(c)
Logic:- (1stno. + 2ndno.) √ó 2 + 2ndno. = 3rd no.
(56 - 31 - 205) :- (56 + 31) √ó 2 + 31 ‚áí 174 + 31 = 205
(88 - 23 - 245) :- (88 + 23) √ó 2 + 23 ‚áí 222 + 23 =245
(18 - 12 - 72) :- (18 + 12) √ó 2 + 12 ‚áí 60 + 12 = 72
But,
(22 - 13 - 85) :- (22 + 13) √ó 2 + 13 ‚áí 70 + 13 = 83 ‚â† 85

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the following sets. (NOTE : Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. (8, 64, 128)

(8, 64, 128) :- (8 √ó 64) √ó 2 ‚áí (8 √ó 8) √ó 2 = 128
Similarly,
(12, 144, 288) :- (12 √ó 144) √ó 2 ‚áí (12 √ó 12) √ó 2 = 288

question: 9 is related to 47 following a certain logic. Following the same logic, 12 is related to 62. To which of the following is 17 related, following the same logic ? (9, 47) :- (9) √ó 5 + 2 = 47
(12, 62) :- (12) √ó 5 + 2 = 62
Similarly,
(17 , 87) :- (17) √ó 5 + 2 = 87

question: Which chromosome is involved in the production of 'masked' mRNAs for early development?
solution: (b) Lampbrush chromosome. These are found in oocytes of animals like sharks, amphibians, reptiles, and birds (most distinct during the Diplotene stage). Polytene Chromosomes - First seen by Balbiani (1881) in salivary glands of larva of Chironomus insect (midges ‚Äî belongs to order Diptera). An autosome is one of the numbered chromosomes, as opposed to the sex chromosomes. Humans have 22 pairs of autosomes and one pair of sex chromosomes (XX or XY).

question: Which of the following sports is played by Siddharth Suchde?
solution: (d) Squash. It is played by two players for singles matches or four players for doubles matches. Other Players: Squash - Saurav Ghosal, Dipika Pallikal, Anahat Singh. Football - Sunil Chhetri, Gurpreet Singh Sandhu. Badminton - Pullela Gopichand, Saina Nehwal, PV Sindhu. Tennis - Sania Mirza, Rohan Bopanna.

question: Which of the following Articles of the Indian Constitution CANNOT be suspended even during an emergency declared on the grounds of war or external aggression?
solution: (b) Articles 20 and 21. Article 14 - Equality before law. Article 15 - Prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth. Article 16 - Equality of opportunity in matters of public employment. Article 17 - Abolition of Untouchability. Article 20 - Protection in respect of conviction for offences. Article 21 - Protection of life and personal liberty. Article 30 - Right of minorities to establish and administer educational institutions.

question: What is the title of the autobiography written by the renowned American professional boxer, Mike Tyson?
solution: (b) Undisputed Truth: My Autobiography. His other important books include ‚ÄòUndisputed Truth‚Äô, ‚ÄòIron Ambition: My Life With Cus D'amato‚Äô, ‚ÄòCenterStage: Twelve of My Most Fascinating Interviews‚Äô etc.

question: Who asked James Rennel to prepare the map of Hindustan?
solution: (d) Robert Clive served twice as Governor of Bengal (1758-60 and 1764-67) and also led the Battle of Plassey on behalf of the British East India Company in 1757. James Rennel was the first Surveyor General of Bengal (1767-1777) and conducted the first comprehensive geographical survey of much of India. He is best known for his "Bengal Atlas" (1779) and "Memoir of a Map of Hindoostan" (1782).

question: Which of the following is the most dominant species of the Tropical Deciduous Forests ?
solution: (d) Teak. Tropical Dry Deciduous Vegetation occurs in an irregular wide strip running from the foot of the Himalayas to Kanyakumari, excluding Rajasthan, the Western Ghats, and West Bengal. Examples of species found in these forests include Khair, Bamboo, Palas, Amaltas, and Babool.

question: In which state of India was the Neeru-Meeru programme introduced for construction of water harvesting structures?
solution: (a) Andhra Pradesh. The Neeru-Meeru (Water and You) program was launched by the Water Conservation Mission (WCM), on May 1, 2000. It was a Water conservation and poverty alleviation initiative.

question: Who of the following is famous for playing the musical instrument Kanjira?
solution: (c) Pudukkottai Dakshinamurthi Pillai. His Awards: Kalaimamani award (1985), Sahitya Kala Parishad award (1992). Other Indian Kanjira players: Anandan Sivamani, Jamey Haddad, Natarajan Ganesh Kumar.

question: The Environment (Protection) Act, 1986 empowers the _________ to establish authorities charged with the mandate of preventing environmental pollution in all its forms.
solution: (b) Central Government. The Environment (Protection) Act, 1986 was enacted to safeguard and enhance the environment. The Central Government has the authority to: protect and improve the environment, set emission and discharge standards, regulate industrial locations, manage hazardous wastes, and protect public health and welfare. Some key environmental acts include the Biological Diversity Act (2002), Wild Life (Protection) Act (1972), Forest Conservation Act (1980), Indian Forest Act (1927), and Energy Conservation Act (2001).

question: Dr. B. C. Roy Trophy is an Indian football tournament for :
solution: (c) under-19 players. The Junior National Football Championship, also known as BC Roy Trophy, is an Indian football tournament held for players under-15 years of age representing the states of India. It was formerly held for the U-19 age group before being converted into an U-15 tournament from the 2023-24 edition.

question: Who among the following was honoured by the Sangeet Natak Akademi for his contribution to the Bharatanatyam dance form ?
solution: (d) Radha Sridhar. She received this award in 2018. Other exponents of the sangeet natak academy awards (2018) include: Shri Maulik Shah for Kathak, Akham Lakshmi Devi for Manipuri dance, Shrimati Surupa Sen for Odissi dance.

question: Unemployment that occurs during recessions and depressions are called as ________.
solution: (d) Cyclical unemployment - It occurs due to fluctuations in the overall economy. Disguised unemployment is unemployment with low productivity that does not affect aggregate output. Frictional unemployment is a form of unemployment reflecting the gap between someone voluntarily leaving a job and finding another. Seasonal unemployment is when people who work in seasonal jobs become unemployed when demand for labor decreases.

question: If the recipient of Employee provident Fund (EPF) withdrawal does not provide his PAN, TDS on the withdrawal will be ________, instead of the maximum marginal rate as per new budget of 2023.
solution: (a) 20%. The Employees‚Äô Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO), under the administrative control of the Ministry of Labour and Employment, regulates the norms for the employees‚Äô contributory provident fund. Under the EPF scheme, the employee contributes 12% of their basic pay, and the employer matches this contribution. The employer‚Äôs EPF contribution is divided into two parts: 8.33% goes to the pension scheme, and 3.67% goes to the EPF corpus.

question: Which of the following devices is used to accelerate charged particles to high velocities?
solution: (b) Cyclotron. It is a device invented by E.O. Lawrence in 1929, that is used for accelerating charged particles (such as protons, deutron or Œ±‚Äìparticles) to high velocities. It consists of two semi-circular hollow metallic disks DD, called dees, on account of their shape resembling the letter D of the English alphabet.

question: Who among the following famous personalities was awarded the prestigious German Peace Prize ?
solution: (c) Salman Rushdie. Salman Rushdie, the renowned Indian-British author, was awarded the prestigious German Peace Prize (Friedenspreis des Deutschen Buchhandels) in 2004. Books by Salman Rushdie: ‚Äò‚ÄôSatanic Verses‚Äô‚Äô, ‚Äò‚ÄôMidnight's Children‚Äô‚Äô, ‚Äò‚ÄôVictory City‚Äô‚Äô, ‚Äò‚ÄôThe Moor's Last Sigh‚Äô‚Äô, ‚Äò‚ÄôThe Ground Beneath Her Feet: A Novel‚Äô‚Äô, ‚Äò‚ÄôShalimar the Clown: A Novel‚Äô‚Äô.

question: Two masses of 1 kg and 2 kg were dropped from a height of 3.2 metres. Their respective velocities just before touching the ground will be: (Assume acceleration due to gravity g = 10 m/s¬≤)
solution:
(d) 8 m/s for both. We can calculate the velocities of the two masses just before touching the ground using the equation of motion for free fall: ùë£ = 2gh
Where:
v = velocity just before touching the ground
g = acceleration due to gravity (10 m/s¬≤)
h = height from which the masses were dropped (3.2m)
For both masses (1 kg and 2 kg), the velocity will be the same because the equation is independent of mass:
v= 2‚úï10‚úï3.2
ùë£ = 64
ùë£ = 8 m/s
Hence, the velocities of both masses just before touching the ground will be 8 m/s.

question: __________ is a lively dance form of the Bundelkhand region. Its performance begins with the beating of mridang and gradually gains momentum dotted with prose and poetic dialogues.
solution: (d) Swang - A popular folk dance - theatre form performed in Rajasthan, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh and Malwa region of Madhya Pradesh. Other dances: Rai - This dance of Bundelkhand is performed by a man disguised as a woman to the accompaniment of musical instruments like dholak and nagara. Matki - A community dance from the Malwa region, performed by women. Gangaur - Performed during the nine days of Gangaur festival in the Nimar region in honour of their deity Ranubai and Dhaniyer Suryadev.

question: Which inert gas is used in double-glazed windows to fill the space between the panes?
solution: (c) Argon is used in double-glazed windows because it has low thermal conductivity, which enhances the insulating properties of the window. This helps to reduce heat transfer, making the windows more energy-efficient by minimizing heat loss in the winter and heat gain in the summer. The noble gases are the naturally occurring elements in group 18 of the periodic table : Helium (He), Neon (Ne), Argon (Ar), Krypton (Kr), Xenon (Xe), and Radon (Rn).

question: Phytoplanktons are ________.
solution: (c) Producers in pond ecosystem. The autotrophic components include the phytoplankton, some algae and the floating, submerged and marginal plants found at the edges. The consumers are represented by the zooplankton, the free swimming and bottom dwelling forms. The decomposers are the fungi, bacteria and flagellates especially abundant in the bottom of the pond.

question: Shovana Narayan is associated with which of these dance forms?
solution: (b) Kathak. Her Award: Padma Shri (1992). Other Important exponents in : Kathak (Uttar Pradesh) - Birju Maharaj, Gopi Krishna, Sitara Devi, Uma Sharma. Kathakali (Kerala) - Kalamandalam Gopi, Kalamandalam Krishna Prasad. Bharatanatyam (Tamil Nadu) - Meenakshi Sundaram Pillai, Balasarswati. Mohiniattam (Kerala) - Jayaprabha Menon, Samitha Rajan.

question: What is the name of India‚Äôs first electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) air taxi?
solution: (b) Shunya. Sarla Aviation, a Bengaluru-based aerospace startup, has unveiled ‚ÄòShunya.‚Äô It is designed for short trips of 20-30 kilometers, accommodating up to six passengers with a maximum payload of 680 kg.

question: Name the dance of Rajasthan which uses a fake horse ride as a prop.
solution: (d) Kacchi Ghodi. Other dances in Rajasthan - Bhavai Folk dance, Chari Folk Dance, Chakri, Fire Folk dance, Gair, Ghoomar, Gawri, Kalbelia, Kathputli Folk Dance, Terah Taali. Folk dances of India - Pavri Nach, Dindi and Kala - Maharashtra; Bagurumba - Assam; Jata-Jatin, Bakho-Bakhain, and Panwariya - Bihar; and Ghode Modini - Goa.

question: Who inaugurated the National Turmeric Board in New Delhi in January 2025?
solution: (c) Piyush Goyal. Shri Goyal announced Shri Palle Ganga Reddy as its first Chairperson. The headquarters of the Board has been set up at Nizamabad. India is the largest producer, consumer and exporter of turmeric in the world. India has more than 62% share of world trade. During 2023-24, 1.62 lakh tonnes of turmeric and turmeric products valued at 226.5 million USD was exported.

question: Who among the following is the wife of Chandragupta I.
solution: (c) Kumaradevi. Chandragupta I was a Gupta ruler, and his wife belonged to the Lichchhavi clan. He was the first ruler of the Gupta dynasty to adopt the title of Maharajadhiraja. Samudragupta was the son of Chandragupta I and Queen Kumaradevi.

question: The dry cell is made up of an outer __________ container that acts as the anode.
solution: (d) zinc. A dry cell is a type of zinc-carbon battery composed of the following parts : Carbon Rod - Positioned centrally, this rod functions as the cathode. Electrolyte - A paste made of ammonium chloride surrounds the zinc anode, facilitating the flow of ions. Manganese Dioxide Shield - This shield surrounds the cell, helping to improve the efficiency and longevity of the battery.

question: The angle of elevation of a lamp post changes from 30¬∞ to 60¬∞ when a person walks 30 m towards it. Find the height of the lamp post.

(c)

Height of the lamp post = AB
In ŒîABC,
tan 60¬∞ = ABBC
‚áí 3=ABBC
‚áí AB = 3BC
In ŒîABD,
tan 30¬∞ = ABBC+30
‚áí 13=3 BCBC+30
‚áíBC + 30 = 3 BC
‚áí BC = 15 m
AB = 153m

question: The simple interest on a certain sum of money at rate of interest 6% per annum for 2 years is Rs. 960. What is the compound interest (compounding annually) on the same sum for the same period and at the same rate of interest ?
solution:
(b)
Let principal be 100%
6% √ó 2 = 12% -------------- ‚Çπ960
100% -------------- 96012√ó100 = ‚Çπ8,000
Successive rate for 2 years = 6 + 6 + 6√ó6100 = 12.36%
CI on the same sum for the same period at the same rate = 8000√ó(5350)2 - 8,000 = 8000 √ó 12.36% = ‚Çπ 988.8.

question: A boat can travel 16.9 km downstream in 52 min. If the speed of the current is 3 km/h, then how much time (in hours) will the boat take to travel 84 km upstream ?
solution:
(c)
Downstream speed = 16.95260 = 19.5 km/h
Speed of (boat + current) = 19.5
Speed of boat = 19.5 - 3 = 16.5 km/h
Time taken upstream = 8416.5 - 3 = 8413.5 = 8413.5 = 6.22

question: A man has to discharge a debt of ‚Çπ15,600 which is due in 3 years at 4% simple interest per annum. If he pays this amount in equal installments of annual payment, find the amount for annual payment.
solution:
(d) Rate = 4% = 1‚ÜíInterest25‚Üí Installment
Debt = 25 √ó 3 + 1(2 + 1) = 75 + 3 = 78 unit
Now, 78 unit = ‚Çπ15,600
Then, 25 unit = 1560078 √ó 25 = ‚Çπ5,000

question: If the intersection point of the equations 3p ‚àí 2q + 23 = 0 and ‚àí2p + q ‚àí 13 = 0 on the graph is (p, q), then the value of (3p + q) is equal to:
solution:
(b)
3p ‚àí 2q + 23 = 0 -------(i)
‚àí2p + q ‚àí 13 = 0 -------(ii)
Equation (i) + 2 √ó equation(ii) we get;
3p ‚àí 2q + 23 + 2(‚àí2p + q ‚àí 13) = 0
- p - 3 = 0
p = - 3
Put, p = - 3 in equation (i) we get;
3(-3) ‚àí 2q + 23 = 0
‚àí 2q = -14
q = 7
Then, (3p + q) = 3 √ó - 3 + 7 = - 2

question:
The number 611611611611 is:
(a) divisible by both 6 and 11
(b) neither divisible by 6 nor by 11
(c) divisible by 6 only
(d) divisible by 11 only
solution:
(b)
611611611611
As per question check divisibility by 6 and 11
For divisibility of 6 it must be divisible by 2 and 3
611611611611 is not divisible by 2 hence it is not divisible by 6 also
now , for divisibility of 11 , sum of alternate digits
1 + 6 + 1 + 1 + 6 + 1 = 16
6 + 1 + 1 + 6 + 1 + 1 = 16
Difference of sum of alternate digits = 16 - 16 = 0
Hence it is divisible by 11 only.

question: Ajay spends 6623% of his income on different household items. If his income increases by 25% and expenditure increase by 20%, then the effect on his savings will be:
solution:
(d) 6623% = 23
Let the initial income of Ajay be 300
Ratio - initial : final
Income - 300 : 375
Expendi. - 200 : 240
--------------------------------------
Savings - 100 : 135
Effect on saving (increased) = 135 - 100100 √ó 100 = 35%

question: Scales, pencils and erasers are available in packets of 6, 10 and 12 respectively. If a shopkeeper wants to buy equal number of these items, then what is the minimum number of packets of scales, pencils and erasers respectively he needs to buy ?
solution:
(c)
According to question,
LCM (6, 10, 12) = 60
Number of packets of scales = 606 = 10
Number of packets of pencil = 6010 = 6
Number of packets of erasers = 6012 = 5

question: One-quarter of a circular pizza of radius 21 cm was removed from the whole pizza. What is the perimeter (in cm) of the remaining pizza? (Use œÄ = 227)
solution:

= 2 √ó 227 √ó 21 √ó 34 + 2 √ó 21
= 99 + 42 = 141 cm

question: Two chords AB and CD of a circle are produced to intersect each other at a point P outside the circle. If AB = 7 cm, BP = 4.2 cm and PD = 2.8 cm, then the length of CD is:
solution:
(c)

Using intersecting secant theorem,
BP√óAP = DP √ó CP
4.2 √ó 11.2 = 2.8 √ó (2.8+x)
4.2 √ó 11.2 2.8 = (2.8+x)
16.8 = 2.8+x
x = 16.8 - 2.8 = 14 cm

question: Which of the following can be the value of k, if (88√∑8√ók-3√ó3)(62-7√ó5+k2) = 1 ?
solution:
(a) 88 √∑ 8 √ó k - 3 √ó 362 - 7 √ó 5 + k2 = 1
‚áí 11 √ó k - 9 36 - 35 + k2 = 1
‚áí 11k - 9 = 1 + k¬≤
‚áí k¬≤ - 11k + 10 = 0
‚áí k¬≤ - 10k - k + 10 = 0
‚áí k(k - 10) - 1(k - 10) = 0
‚áí (k - 10)(k - 1) = 0
‚áí k = 10 and 1

question: When ‚ÄòX‚Äô is added to each of the numbers 7, 11, 18 and 23, then the number so obtained are in proportion. What is the mean proportional between the (x - 1) and (2x -10) ?
solution:
(c)
Value of x =|ad-bc(a+d)-(b+c)|=|7√ó23-11√ó18(7+23)-(11+18)|=|161-198(30)-(29)|=|-371|=37

\n

Then, mean proportion of (x - 1) and (2x -10) = (x-1) (2x-10) = (37-1) (74-10)
= 36√ó64 = 6 √ó 8 = 48

question: A person mixes two liquids, x and y. One litre of x weighs approximately 900 g, and one litre of y weighs approximately 750 g. If one litre of the mixture weighs approximately 800 g, then the percentage of x in the mixture is:

question: Two rectangular sheets of paper, each 60 cm √ó 36 cm, are made into two right circular cylinders, one by rolling the paper along its length and the other along the breadth. The ratio of the volumes of the two cylinders, thus formed, is:
solution:
(d)
Case 1: When the sheet of paper is rolled along its length to form a cylinder,
then the circumference of the base of the cylinder = length of the rectangular sheet
height of the cylinder = breadth of the rectangular sheet.
Let radius = r and height = h = 36 cm
Circumference of base = 60 cm
2œÄr = 60 cm
r = 30œÄcm
Volume of the cylinder formed (V1) = œÄr2h = œÄ √ó 30œÄ √ó30œÄ√ó 36‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. (i) .
Case 2: When the sheet of paper is rolled along its breadth to form a cylinder, then the circumference of the base of the cylinder = the breadth of the rectangular sheet
height of the cylinder = length of the rectangular sheet.
Let radius = R and height = H = 60 cm
Circumference of base = 36 cm
2œÄR = 36 cm
R = 18œÄ cm
Volume of the cylinder formed (V2) = œÄR2H = œÄ √ó18œÄ√ó 18œÄ√ó 60 .....(ii)
Now,
V1 : V2 = œÄ √ó 30œÄ √ó30œÄ√ó 36 : œÄ √ó18œÄ√ó 18œÄ √ó 60
V1 : V2 = 5 : 3
Thus, the ratio of the volumes of the two cylinders so formed is 5 : 3.

question: A can complete a work in 7 hours, B and C can complete it in 214 hours, and C and A can complete it in 72hours. How much time will B take to complete the work alone ?
solution:
(c)

Efficiency of (C + A - B -C) = 6 - 4
Efficiency of (A - B) = 2 unit
Efficiency of B = A - 2
So, efficiency of B = 3 - 2 = 1 unit
Work done by B = 211 = 21 hours

question: If the median and the mode of a set of data are 12 and 15 respectively, then find the value of thrice of the mean of the same data set.
solution:
(a)

‚áí 15 = 3 √ó 12 - 2 mean
‚áí 2 mean = 36 - 15
‚áí mean = 212
Now, 3 mean = 632

question: A person wants to buy 10 chairs. The total cost of 10 chairs is ‚Çπ4,500. After bargaining, the shopkeeper agrees to decrease the cost of each chair by 20%. Then, the person purchased 10% more chairs. What will be the cost of the chairs that he purchased ?
solution:
(a)
Cost of 1 chair = 450010 = 450
Cost of 1 chair after 20% decrement = 450 √ó 80% = 360
Number of chairs purchased by him = 10 √ó 110% = 11
Total cost of chairs that he purchased = 360 √ó 11 = ‚Çπ3960

question: A thief running at 7 km/h is chased by a policeman whose speed is 12 km/h. If the thief is 280 m ahead of the policeman, then the time required for the policeman to catch the thief will be:
solution:
(a)
Relative speed, when travelling in same direction = 12- 7 = 5 km/hr
Then, time required for the policeman to catch the thief = (28010005 √ó 60) min = 8425 = 3925 minutes

question: A pipe can fill an empty tank in 5 minutes and another pipe can empty it in 6 minutes. If both pipes are opened simultaneously, how much time (in minutes) will it take to fill the empty tank?

Time taken together to fill tank = 301 = 30 min.

question: If the odds in favour of an event A are 3 : 4 and the odds against another independent event B are 7 : 4 find the probability that at least one of the event will happen :
solution:
(b) Probability of A = P(A)
= 33 + 4 = 37 and P(A¬Ø) = 47
Probability of B = P(B) = 47 + 4 = 411
and P(B¬Ø) = 711
The required event can be defined as that A takes place and B does not + B takes place and A doesn't + A and B both takes place :-
= 37√ó711+47√ó411+37√ó411
= 2177+1677+1277=711

question: In a group of 200 members, 45% are teenagers and the remaining are adults. The average weight of the whole group is 62 kg. If the average weight of teenagers is 56 kg, then the nearest integral value of the average weight of adults is ____________ .

question: Two offers were being made to Swaroop for a watch with a marked price of ‚Çπ1,600. Either two successive discounts of 20%, or two discounts of 30% and 10% after each other is offered. If Swaroop opted for the better plan over the other, how much more must he have saved?
solution:
(c)
Two successive discount of 20% = 20 + 20 - 20 √ó 20100 = 36%
Two successive discount of 30% and 10% = 30 + 10 - 30 √ó 10100 = 37%
Required amount = 1600 √ó 37 - 36100 = ‚Çπ 16

question: A and B are two stations 420 km apart. A train starts from A at 11 am and travels towards B at the speed of 70 kmph. Another train starts from B at 12 noon and travels towards A at the speed of 30 kmph. At what time do they meet?
solution:
(a)

Distance traveled by train towards B in 1 hr(at 12 pm) = 70 √ó 1 = 70 km
Remaining distance = 420 - 70 = 350 km
Relative speed of train , when travelling towards each other = 70 + 30 = 100 km/hr
Time taken to meet each other = 350100 = 72 = 3 hr 30 minute
Required meeting time = 12 + 3:30 = 3:30 pm

question:
The following sentence has been split into four segments. Identify the segment that contains a grammatical error.
Most of the committee / are here to / decide the fate of / this ancient building.
solution:
(c) are here to
According to the ‚ÄúSubject-Verb Agreement Rule‚Äù, a singular subject always takes a singular verb and a plural subject always takes a plural verb. In the given sentence, ‚ÄòMost of the committee‚Äô is a singular subject that will take ‚Äòis‚Äô as a singular verb. Hence, ‚Äòis here to‚Äô is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the following sentence in passive voice.
Most lizards rely on camouflage to hide from their enemies.
option_1: Camouflage has been relied on by most lizards to hide from their enemies.
option_2: Camouflage is relied on by most lizards to hide from their enemies.
option_3: Camouflage was relied on by most lizards to hide from their enemies.
option_4: Most lizards are being relied on by camouflage to hide from their enemies.
solution:
(b) Camouflage is relied on by most lizards to hide from their enemies. (Correct)
(a) Camouflage has been relied on by most lizards to hide from their enemies. (Incorrect Tense)
(c) Camouflage was relied on by most lizards to hide from their enemies. (Incorrect Tense)
(d) Most lizards are being relied on by camouflage to hide from their enemies. (Incorrect Tense)

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
P. Children head back to the village with bundles of firewood on their heads.
Q. After school, the children take the sheep into the forest to graze.
R. The cheerful voices fade as the sun goes down the Horizon.
S. Along with the other village kids Romi hugs the trees and climbs the trees there.
solution:
(a) QSRP
Sentence Q will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. Children, who take sheep to graze. And, Sentence S states what Romi does after going to the forest. So, S will follow Q. Further, Sentence R states about how the evening goes and Sentence P states that the children go back to the village after that. So, P will follow R. Going through the options, option (a) has the correct sequence.

question:

question:

question:
Cloze Test :
Over the past year, Dr Hemmings has been conducting research on the big cat phenomenon and has already ____96____ the remains of some wild animals that may have been eaten by ____97____ far larger than any of the country‚Äôs known carnivores. The project has ____98____ an analysis of twenty skeletal animal remains ____99____ from across Gloucestershire and other nearby counties. The bones were selected because the ____100____ of their death led people to believe that these animals may have been killed by a big cat.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank No.96
solution:
(d) identified
‚ÄòIdentify‚Äô means to recognize or be able to say who or what somebody/something is. The given passage states that Dr Hemmings has been conducting research on the big cat phenomenon and has already identified the remains of some wild animals. Hence, ‚Äòidentified‚Äô is the most appropriate answer.

question:

question:

question:
Cloze Test :
Over the past year, Dr Hemmings has been conducting research on the big cat phenomenon and has already ____96____ the remains of some wild animals that may have been eaten by ____97____ far larger than any of the country‚Äôs known carnivores. question:
